preqs: Completion of one of the core units (APG4900 or APG5662)

rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {APG4662, APG4900}
Must be enrolled in course type {03, 04}

description: The unit explores the production, consumption and distribution of contemporary art from sociological and historical perspectives. By 'art worlds' we understand the complex relationship between artists, institutions, markets and related skills and services. This unit will explore these relationships in detail using local and international case studies. Students will gain an understanding of the changing values and practices of contemporary art, including new artistic practices in urban spaces, the changing practices of museums (blockbusters, experience-based curation), the globalization of the contemporary art market and the investment by cities in contemporary art as part of global branding strategies.
